simple.name: hostName
simple.description: Host name on which the device is deployed

simple.name: DeviceKind
simple.description: The type of this device

simple.name: os_name
simple.description: SCA required property describing the Operating System Name.

simple.name: os_version
simple.description: SCA required property describing the Operating System Version

simple.name: processor_name
simple.description: SCA required property describing the CPU type

simple.name: processor_cores
simple.description: The number of true processing cores that can execute programs concurrently (i.e. not hyperthreaded). Although external, implemented with behavior identical to a matching property with action 'le'

simplesequence.name: processor_flags
simplesequence.description: The flags associated with the CPU, for e.g., 'sse2'

simple.name: memTotal
simple.description: Total amount of RAM installed in the GPP

simple.name: memFree
simple.description: Amount of RAM in the GPP not in use (measured)

simple.name: memCapacity
simple.description: Amount of RAM in the GPP not allocated to an application

simple.name: memThreshold
simple.description: Percentage of total system memory this GPP can use for capacity management.

simple.name: mcastnicInterface
simple.description: The Multicast NIC interface associated with this GPP (e.g. eth1). If not provided no multicast allocations are permitted.

simple.name: mcastnicIngressTotal
simple.description: Total NIC bandwidth for the interfaces defined in mcastnicInterface. This must be specified in the PRF or DCD because ethtool requires super-user privs.

simple.name: mcastnicEgressTotal
simple.description: Total NIC bandwidth for the interfaces defined in mcastnicInterface. This must be specified in the PRF or DCD because ethtool requires super-user privs.

simple.name: mcastnicIngressCapacity
simple.description: Amount of ingress multicast NIC capacity in the GPP not allocated to an application

simple.name: mcastnicEgressCapacity
simple.description: Amount of egress multicast NIC capacity in the GPP not allocated to an application

simple.name: mcastnicIngressFree
simple.description: Free NIC bandwidth for the interfaces defined in mcastnicInterface.

simple.name: mcastnicEgressFree
simple.description: Free NIC bandwidth for the interfaces defined in mcastnicInterface.

simple.name: mcastnicThreshold
simple.description: Percentage of total Multicast NIC this GPP can use for capacity management.

simple.name: loadTotal
simple.description: Equal to "processor_cores" x "loadCapacityPerCore".

simple.name: loadCapacityPerCore
simple.description: The performance ratio of this machine, relative to the benchmark machine.

simple.name: loadFree
simple.description: Equal to loadCapacity

simple.name: loadCapacity
simple.description: The amount of load capacity remaining to be allocated.

simple.name: loadThreshold
simple.description: Percentage of toal load that can be used for capacity.

simple.name: diskThreshold
simple.description: Percentage of total disk this GPP can use for capacity management.

simple.name: useScreen
simple.description: If true, GNU screen will be used for the execution of components.

simple.name: componentOutputLog
simple.description: If provided, all component output will be redirected to this file. The GPP will not delete or rotate these logs. The provided value may contain environment variables or reference component exec-params with @EXEC_PARAM@. For example, this would be a valid value $SDRROOT/logs/@COMPONENT_IDENTIFIER@.log
The rate at which property events will be emitted for back-ground status

simplesequence.name: mcastnicVLANs
simplesequence.description: When queired, returns the list of vlans on this host. When used as an allocation, defines the list of VLANS the component requires.

struct.name: loadAverage
struct.description: The current load average, as reported by /proc/loadavg. Each core on a computer can have a load average between 0.0 and 1.0. This differs greatly from CPU percentage (as reported by top). Load averages differ in two significant ways: 1) they measure the trend of CPU utlization, and 2) they include all demand for the CPU not only how much was active at the time of measurement. Load averages do not include any processes or threads waiting on I/O, networking, databases, or anything else not demanding the CPU.

structsequence.name: fileSystems
structsequence.description: The list of file systems mounted on this host and their current usage.

structsequence.name: diskCapacity
structsequence.description: Used as an allocatation dependency to ensure the specified path has enough disk space.

simple.name: diskCapacityPath
simple.description: The path that your component intends to write to, the mount point is determined based off this path. Environment variables, in the form ${VAR} may be used. Components should generally use ${SDRROOT} or ${TMPDIR} as the basis for capacity allocation. This will ensure maximum portability to other systems. The referenced path must exist on the system and be a directory.

simple.name: diskCapacity
simple.description: The amount of capacity on the path that your component requires. Note, the allocation will be successful even if the path does not exist or if the path is not writable. The capacity check simply ensures that the mount point that holds the specified path has enough free space.

simple.name: diskrateTotalDevice
simple.description: The device that the diskrate was measured against.

simple.name: diskrateCapacityPath
simple.description: The path that your component intends to write to, the mount point is determined based off this path. Environment variables, in the form ${VAR} may be used. Components should generally use ${PWD}, ${SDRROOT}, or ${TMPDIR} as the basis for capacity allocation. This will ensure maximum portability to other systems.
